name: Fuzzy Engine
short_description:
Small university project of mine, calculates 7 given engine sound sample-sets to represent realistic engine sound.

-The realtime volume fading of different samples is calculated by fuzzy logic sets using rpm and load as input.
-Engine Load is calculated by a fuzzy logic set using throttle and current rpm as input.
-rpm is calculated by adding the calculated engine load vector.
-every calculation is based on a 20ms loop, executed in a second thread (.net backgroundworker)
-to pitch, fade and play samples, microsoft XNA framework has been used.
-to calculate fuzzy sets, dotFuzzy has been used.
-to illustrate engine rpm and valuebars, codeplex dashboarding has been used.
-to illustrate the behaviour,  visiblox charts have been used.
-developement environment: Visual Studio 2010, (WPF with C#).

see it in action:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MaJlUyA8Kr0
